website_summaries.verdict: Your best option if you're looking for larger baby food storage containers suitable for older infants and toddlers.
pros: Made of BPA-free plastic with screw-on lids
Each container holds up to 4-ounces of baby food
cons: Not as durable as some other containers

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you order and hit “new”.
customer_reviews.text: Not too sure if these came new? They didn’t have any other packaging aside from the box they were delivered in. The containers were haphazardly placed in there, some weren’t even facing the same direction. Aside from the jars facing different locations, sans safety packaging, the stickers were just idling measly in the box with rubber band tying them together. This seems like an out-of-garage sale.
customer_reviews.author: Banana nana

customer_reviews.title: Big help with separating baby’s foods
customer_reviews.text: I filled each of them with water and placed up side down to see if any of them leak. None! The cover can seal firmly. It is east to clean, I just put on the top rack of dishwasher. It also comes with food labels, so that is handy. It is made in the USA. and it is BPA free. It is said that you can warm in the microwave, but I like to warm baby’s foods in a bowl of hot water in case the foods are warmed unevenly, as it might be too hot on the outside and too cold on the inside.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Wang

customer_reviews.title: I've been using this forever and for multi purpose
customer_reviews.text: I bought Sage (plastic) jars because my son's daycare (at that time he was 6 month old) didn't allow "glass" jars. My son is now 2.5 month old and I still use Sage to pack his snacks. I am buying more to store solids for my 6 month old baby girl. Oh and my husband uses it as a shot glass once in a while (he loves it cuz it has the measurements) and sometimes I use it to scoop stuff (rice, baking soda etc). I am a fan! :)
customer_reviews.author: Angel Monkey

customer_reviews.title: Great product, keeps baby food fresh, easy to clean, labels are great
customer_reviews.text: These containers have been great so far. My daughter is 6 months and I've been making her homemade fruit and veggie purees and needed more containers to store them in. I like these because they're not to big and not too small. They have labels that are easily removed too so I know what is what. I keep most in the freezer and the lids have been nice and secure, they seem to keep everything nice and fresh. I would definitely recommend these to anyone looking for storage for homemade baby foods, I'm sure they probably can be used for many other things as well.
customer_reviews.author: JENN WEIDMAN

customer_reviews.title: Many uses
customer_reviews.text: We have been making out own baby food so we have been filling these containers and putting them in the freezer. They are perfect for this and to send to day care. Only issue we have is if they fall the lip on the bottom of the containers has been cracked/broken a few times when they feel out of the freezer. Not sure if it is cause it is cold or a weak material. The containers its self does not break though so they are still usable.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: After a few months of use, I see neither stains from the food nor damage from heating in the microwave. They've held up to the dishwasher and are quite sturdy as well. I'm 100% satisfied with the cups. My only complaint would lie with the included labels. While they are easy to remove, even after accidentally putting a labeled lid through the dishwasher, ink smears quite easily. Since I'm left-handed, this always leads to blurry labels. Though given the quality of the cups themselves, I feel like I'm nitpicking this product if I have to complain about the labels.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew J.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for homemade baby food
customer_reviews.text: These are the perfect size for storing (and serving) homemade baby purees. They go from freezer to microwave so there's no in perfect portions. I originally wanted these to send to daycare, since they'd be more similar to store-bought baby food as far as measurements, but I use them at home sometimes too because of the convenience factor. Definitely worth buying!
customer_reviews.author: richa521

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for toddler's daily meals
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for packing snacks and/or freezing. They're still holding up 2 yrs later in perfect shape, even after being thrown, dropped, and rough handled by our toddler, and dishwasher safe. We pack our little one's fruit, veggies, and meat in each one to take to the sitters every day. Please tell me it's helpful if you agree 🙂
customer_reviews.author: Marsha

customer_reviews.title: Cute and perfect size for my 9 month oldbaby
customer_reviews.text: They get delivered in a box without original packaging which seems like they just have a bucket of these somewhere and stack them in boxes but as soon as i receive them i am washing them before use anyways so it is okay. These are the perfect size for my 9 month old baby and i bought 2 sets! So useful and cute and perfect for babyfood! I make new batches of food every 3-4 days so perfect for that use! Would not recommend liquid only.. would probably leak! Also i do not recommend warming the food in these... common sense!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: I love the measurement markings on the side
customer_reviews.text: Microwave- and freezer-safe, these plastic containers hold the same amount of homemade food that regular baby food containers do. I love the measurement markings on the side! The stickers that come with it are a perfect fit, although I wonder what I will do after I have reused these several times and just want to replace the stickers... In any case, these are a great purchase for a parent who is looking to make their own baby food. They seem to seal well (although I haven't tried traveling with them full) and would probably make good containers for lunch boxes or after-school snacks, too.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: I love thrse containers easy to clean, store and use for baby food. I used the labels but cut them in half to make more use of them. I highly recommend if you make your own baby food at home. I bought 4 oz defrost them and use them within two days.
customer_reviews.author: Dkhill

customer_reviews.title: Love these! I've used them for storing homemade baby ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these! I've used them for storing homemade baby food in the fridge and freezer, but I also use them for my older kids and around the house. They are the perfect size for snacks and in school lunches. And I like to store my daughter's tiny hair bands in these. The lids are secure enough to prevent any leaks, but easy for the older kids to open themselves. I got some of these directly from Sage Spoonfuls to try out and review, but I've also purchased this set with MY OWN MONEY, so take that for what you will.
customer_reviews.author: Lil Mondu

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: I have no problems with these cups and I have been using for a few months. They do no leak, are the perfect portion size for my baby, and have a wide enough opening where it’s easy to get food in and out and easy to clean. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Baby Food Storage
customer_reviews.text: I started making baby food by freezing silicon trays but struggled to find containers that would fit enough cubes to thaw and warm in our bottle warmer for each feeding. I ended up ordering two sets of these containers, so I can make our baby food in weekly batches. We've been using these for 4 months and the bottom lip is starting to chip on some and others are starting to discolor, but overall I'm super happy with the quality of these containers.
customer_reviews.author: McDermom

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: I love these jars! They are plastic, with screw on lids. They have never leaked for me, and hold the perfect amount of food for my little one. Plus, the labels it comes with are perfect! I don’t have any complaints about these jars and I also think they are a great price! I usually only do 3-3.5 oz even though they hold more just for freezing purposes, but if I’m just refrigerating or using on the go then I can put 4 oz in. The labels are also easy to remove once done.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Taylor

customer_reviews.title: MUST BUY
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE THESE!!! Absolutely perfect! Exactly what I was looking for! I use these for soooo many things! I use them as snack cups for going out and about or when we are visiting family I make her oatmeal in it! I use them for thawing her frozen solids overnight...the possibilities are endless! I always get great comments about how nifty and handy they are!
customer_reviews.author: Elise Blair

customer_reviews.title: Nice containers
customer_reviews.text: I originally was leaning towards the glass jars but found out they are all made in China so I went with the BPA free plastic containers because they are made in the USA. That pretty much sealed the deal for me as I will not be purchasing Chinese made products anymore. They are high quality and I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Bolliger

customer_reviews.title: Love these!!
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING CONTAINERS! I've used these for almost a year and they are still in perfect shape. I put them in the freezer, microwave, and dishwasher and they hold up to everything. Love the portion sizes and even fill them with little snacks for on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Mendez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: They work! This is my second set of jars from this brand and so far I'm happy with the product. It's easy to clean, good size, they nest well, freezer safe. I don't microwave anything in them--I don't like heating up food in plastic anyway. I've used them for almost 4 months now with no problem. I would of purchased the glass ones but I drop everything and I knew plastic jars would the best route for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have for DIY baby food
customer_reviews.text: I love these I’ve bought about 4 sets now so I can have a huge freezer stash of baby food! They are nice to take along to places knowing they are plastic and the lid screws on!
customer_reviews.author: Francis

customer_reviews.title: Great for freezing or on the go
customer_reviews.text: These are great quality and huge! I am usually worried about plastic containers as they can become weak over time but these are great. I’ve dropped several with frozen food and had zero issues Dishwasher safe is a great perk and I have has zero issues with freezer burn on the food. They’re wonderful for prepping little meals you want to freeze or take on the go!
customer_reviews.author: Nagnot

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I use these for my grade school kids. They had trouble with the snap on style lids and these have been a life saver! They hold just the right amount of anything I want to put in them and I can fit two in their lunch boxes along side their sandwiches and drinks. They work great for portion control as well. We've never had any leaking with "soft" liquids (pudding, cottage cheese, dressing, etc). These containers have been in rotation for over a year now and show no signs of wear or tear. Well worth buying!
customer_reviews.author: Walker

customer_reviews.title: If you make baby food you need these
customer_reviews.text: These little containers have worked great for making my baby's food and storing. They freeze well and I haven't seen any chipping or scratching like cheap plastic will do. I've even used a couple for breastmilk storage and they work great! These, thirty minute's time, and my Ninja blender will allow me to prep weeks worth of food and store it safely for my munchkin. I am looking forward to using them for snack portions as he gets a little bit older as well. A must buy for meal prepping parents! ❤
customer_reviews.author: sp92216

customer_reviews.title: Perfect containers!
customer_reviews.text: These little containers are wonderful for kids of all ages! My little ones have outgrown the baby food stage, so for the time being, we use them as little snack containers or popsicle molds! They clean easily, hold up well and are the perfect size for little hands. I can’t wait to use them when I start making baby food again!
customer_reviews.author: Alex Owens

customer_reviews.title: They are easy to clean and hold a good amount of food
customer_reviews.text: This were just what I was looking for to store food for my infant son to eat at daycare! They are easy to clean and hold a good amount of food. I have frozen them yet, but I have put them in the dishwasher and they clean pretty well in there. You might have to do some more scrubbing of the rim. I highly recommend and am considering getting more just so I don't have to clean so many each day.
customer_reviews.author: po511

customer_reviews.title: Best
customer_reviews.text: These are a favorite in my household! We own a lot of these! We send my son to school every day with one filled with vegetables and one filled with fruit! They are lightweight, very durable, and completely leakproof! We use them for everything!
customer_reviews.author: kr611

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy the Sage Spoonfuls storage containers! You can put purees in them to freeze and put them in the fridge when your ready to. Easy to clean by hand or in the dishwasher. No leaking problems. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jayme

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for baby food purees
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE these. I've used glass containers, which are great for home use, but not practical for frequent transport. I make all my baby's food and these containers are perfect for freezer storage, multiple use, and excellent for daycare since they can only use hot water to warm food. The lids are screw top and stay nice and tight when warming in water. I only fill them to the 3 oz. mark for freezer use, but I'll fill to the top for refrigerator storage. A worthwhile purchase for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Functional
customer_reviews.text: I bought for baby puree. They store the puree nicely & I love the labels that come with them. They were easy to put in dishwasher to initially wash & the lids I placed in the silverware rack area to wash. They came out great & I have been using for the babies puree & have been pleased. I will be using for dressings for meal preps & other snacks as baby gets older.
customer_reviews.author: GGC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and leak proof! Great value!
customer_reviews.text: These are great cups! Loved them! Found I used the pouches I bought more than actual cups in the beginning but now that my daughter is older I put cut up foods, yogurts, apple sauce, snack foods in these for the sitter. Handy and I never had a leak or a crack. I Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Meghan C

customer_reviews.title: Extremely convenient!
customer_reviews.text: These work perfectly for homemade baby food. It is easy to transfer the food from the food processor to the jars because the tops are nice and wide. Since the lids twist on and off, I never have to worry about spills if I drop them or bring them to go in the diaper bag. They are durable and wash up easily and very well. I haven't froze food in them yet because I have a silicone tray I use, but when I am ready to defrost the food, I just pop it frozen into one if these jars and stick it in the fridge overnight and the food is ready to go the next day. Very convenient!
customer_reviews.author: Hartwig

customer_reviews.title: I like them for food storage in the freezer and the fridge
customer_reviews.text: I've had these storage cups for several weeks now and I like them. They are easy to clean and the perfect size for storing the fresh pureed baby food I prepare for my daughter. I keep these in the freezer and the fridge and have even put them in the bottle warmer when I need to warm up my baby's food a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Solis-Montero

customer_reviews.title: Great but 1 jar melted
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to pack my daughter's baby food. I placed them all in the top rack of the dishwasher and somehow one container fell at the bottom of the dishwasher and touched the metal that emits heat to dry the dishes. It melted the plastic of course since the plastic was thin. Overall I love that I have 11more jars to use. It works great if you are using the Kiddo Feedo system since the frozen food fits in perfectly. Later on I can use it for snacks and salad dressings.
customer_reviews.author: mrszorak44

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size, stackable & freezable - leaked when filled with liquid.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for baby food! The cups are a nice size (not too big and not too small). I like that they are stackable and can go in the freezer, but I didn't like the fact that the containers leaked when I put liquid in them and they were not level all the time. I would recently these containers, but be aware of their limitations. Please mark if you find my review helpful. Thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: PeggyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: no kids for us, but definitely canine approved!
customer_reviews.text: Love these great little plastic cups! We use them to make doggie ice cream, and even the spaniel can't puncture these with his teeth! We've been freezing and re-freezing them for several months now. They still look brand new. I just bought a second set of these since a double batch of our recipe fills more than 12 of these. The supermarket brands cups all have teeth holes in them and leak as we fill them. The Sage Spoonful cups have passed the spaniel test, and they are all we will use from now on! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent they are 3oz like they say but I tried to freeze 4oz out of it and the caps come up somewhat once the food expands. No freezer burn though. I just make sure the lid is on right once I take it from the freezer. I wish they manufactured 4oz jars.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: I love these cups
customer_reviews.text: I love these cups...but if you're freezing your baby food, be aware that if you drop the said frozen cup, the plastic WILL break. And you will have chips of plastic lids or the bottom of the cup flying everywhere. This has happened a few times to me now. The cups themselves are much more durable than the lids, but those lids don't fare well in the freezer.
customer_reviews.author: LibertyInspired

customer_reviews.title: Not only for baby food!
customer_reviews.text: These are great not only for baby food! I use them the portion out my toddlers food since he is in a phase where he likes to pick his own food from the fridge. I buy bulk fruits and yogurt so these perfectly separate the portions into more toddler friendly sizing. I love that they are light wash and super simple to wash. You can also stack them in the fridge to save space. "I received this from Sage Spoonfuls as a member of their product testing panel"
customer_reviews.author: Janaka

customer_reviews.title: Great for baby purees!
customer_reviews.text: These little containers have been amazing to store baby food purees in! They keep the food stored nicely in the freezer and refrigerator. I haven't experienced any kind of leakage when traveling. I've only thawed/heated the purees with hot water because I find it the best for my baby and the containers let the heat through really well. Over all an amazing product 😁
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Mosher

customer_reviews.title: Great little containers
customer_reviews.text: Great little containers. Keeps moisture out, keeps the food fresh, and easy to store. Only negative is that the constant freezing has caused the bottom rims to break off easily if they're dropped. This doesn't compromise the container, it's just annoying to have to clean up little bits of hard plastic off of the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for homemade baby food
customer_reviews.text: bought these for homemade baby purees. Worked great for that. Now we use them to hold her solid foods each day. Easy to clean and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Noti

customer_reviews.title: Expensive leaky containers
customer_reviews.text: I was really disappointed in these. First of all, I thought that I was purchasing glass containers, but it ended up being plastic. Apparently there are different options of sage containers and you have to select the glass option. That’s my fault for not paying close enough attention. I decided to give them a try and have been really disappointed in them, especially for the price!! These leak HORRIBLY!! If food being stored is not chunky you can pretty much gurantee it’s going to leak. Save yourself some money and find another option!!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Great plastic jars
customer_reviews.text: These are so great. I just ordered my second set. We like to make big batches of food for our toddler and then use these to freeze portions for easy lunches/dinners. These are durable (I've dropped them and they survive, even when frozen) and easy to clean/store. They don't stain - we make a lot of spaghetti with tomato sauce and none have stained, even if we heat them up in the jar. I kinda want another set so I can make even more varieties of food :) My only "complaint" would be that I wish there was a 8 ounce version (in plastic), so I can use these for larger portion sizes.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and cute
customer_reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this. they are perfect for pre-packing my babies food for daycare. I have not had any issue with leaks or cracks. Also great for packing snacks for work.
customer_reviews.author: Nelly

customer_reviews.title: Just one complaint but perfect otherwise
customer_reviews.text: I wish it had something on the outside to make them look less like something for a lab - the logo gives is a laboratory appearance.
customer_reviews.author: Connie the Cat Lady

customer_reviews.title: Convenient!
customer_reviews.text: I made all of my son's baby food. I'm almost 5 months pregnant now with our second baby so I'm very excited to have this product instead of using Tupperware for our homemade baby food. I've already replaced almost all of our product with Sage Spoonfuls for this next baby because of the quality of everything purchased so far. I love how these jars have the ounces listed on the side so I can track how much they're eating as well!
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha DeMartino

customer_reviews.title: Missing Half the Jars!
customer_reviews.text: Jars seem like they work just fine - well enough made etc for the price - but I ordered a set of 12, spent $20, and received six! An absolute rip off. And the only way as far as I can tell to remedy the situation is to print out a return label (quite annoying as I do not own a printer), pack up my six and return them to have a whole new order sent out. They should just send me my missing six. Anyways, not worth the trouble as far as I'm concerned - would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plastic not glass
customer_reviews.text: These say they are glass in the description but they are actually plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Losada

customer_reviews.title: Best deal
customer_reviews.text: They’re exactly as described. These are made in USA so they’re safe to contain food. I used them to make my yogurt and they turned out really good. Love them. I’m gonna buy more. $16 for 12 jars..best deal
customer_reviews.author: Vivian P.

customer_reviews.title: Too small, too flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping that they would work for me. I realized it was four ounces, but once your baby is over 7 months old then it won't be big enough to hold the amount of food she eats. And you certainly can't mix it in the container, which means you will make more dirty dishes. The lid seemed to screw on nice and tight, but the container was very flimsy. I would expect it to crack. I want a thicker, sturdier plastic in my plastic storage containers. The search continues!
customer_reviews.author: p

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, good size
customer_reviews.text: I love these little cups! We store food fresh in here, and also use them to thaw, warm, and feed baby the food we keep in the freezer. The size is great, he’s still only interested in about an ounce or two of food so the measurements on the side are perfect. I’ve had no problems with leaks either. I also REALLY appreciate the low-waste packaging!!! No plastic, just cardboard.
customer_reviews.author: ap

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t even had a chance to use these yet, but placed them in the top rack of the dishwasher to clean them prior to use and one of the lids melted onto the bottom of the dishwasher. The instructions said that they are dishwasher safe in the top rack, but I wouldn’t recommend putting the lids in there.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great containers for child food storage!
customer_reviews.text: I love this containers! After ordering one set, I had to double back and get another. I use them to store homemade food prepared for my 1 year old. They are good quality and have been holding up well for the past few months. Would recommend! (Full disclosure, I handwash them, so I’m not sure how they would hold up in the dishwasher.)
customer_reviews.author: Karra Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Baby food storage made easy
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for storing my baby's food after I steam and puree her vegetables. The jars also fit into the bottle warmer which makes the food easy to reheat.
customer_reviews.author: zlewis

customer_reviews.title: Was really excited for these jars but the first time ...
customer_reviews.text: Was really excited for these jars but the first time in the diaper bag the small juice that was in the purée spilled out we have to place it in a ziplock bag every time and it spills out every time.
customer_reviews.author: Eveline Bermudez

customer_reviews.title: They look like urine sample cups.
customer_reviews.text: A little cheaper looking than I anticipated. They are spill and leakproof though. Very reminiscent of the little pee cups at the doctors office. Will update on durability once they’ve been used a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Benoit

customer_reviews.title: Perfecr
customer_reviews.text: Love them... easy to clean and pretty handy. Good is they can be used for storing a pacifier, snacks, kids vitamins when traveling ETC
customer_reviews.author: antonella

customer_reviews.title: Great item for food prep
customer_reviews.text: Food preparation must have! Just started food prepping last year, and it has made a world of a difference in my health. I use these small containers for side items. Helps me to portion out my food well. They've held up well through continuous usage in my dishwasher. They also feel really well which makes me confident caring multiple of these to work and other activities.
customer_reviews.author: J-Li

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome and very versatile
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! I made homemade baby food and used them for storage... I now use them for snacks.. salad dressing containers in lunches. They are very versatile. I put them on the top rack in the dishwasher to clean and sanitize them.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen G

customer_reviews.title: Durable and well made
customer_reviews.text: These have been perfect for us. I’m glad I went with the 4 oz size, as anything smaller wouldn’t have been used for long. This fits perfectly in a standard bottle/food warmer. The only issue has been that multiple frozen purée cubes don’t fit well because it’s circular, but I just set them out ahead of time and let them thaw a little before screwing on the lid. No leaking and they’ve been dropped a few times without any issues!
customer_reviews.author: Alex S.

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t receive all of my containers
customer_reviews.text: Product came on time and just as expected perfect size easy to clean and easy to pack for on the go but i only received 10 in my pack instead of a 12 count
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: Great little jars! Easy to store lots of baby food when i go on my baby food making crazes! They travel well, clean easily and make me feel good that we are able to provide healthy homemade food!
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and efficient
customer_reviews.text: My 10 month old still needs these jars, I can't function without them! I bought the 12 pack when I was pregnant, but had to buy another set bc I make too much food for her in bulk! Awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: great small containers with screw on lids
customer_reviews.text: I like the lid, it is very easy to use. I use them for various purposes. First I used them to store home made yogurt. Now I use them to pack small items (like fruits or nuts) for lunch. They also would be perfect to store home made baby food. And they don't leak.
customer_reviews.author: Dina Romanova

customer_reviews.title: Containers doesn't stain or deteriorate
customer_reviews.text: The containers are the best, doesn't change colors based on the different baby foods I warm up for my little one. It also doesn't deteriorate when warming up some of the baby foods. These containers are actually better than some of the Rubbermaid plastic containers. You will not be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Valencia L. Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Nice small jars, no leaks
customer_reviews.text: Great quality cups. Have had no leaks so far. Using to pre-make bullet proof coffee additives for travel (oil, butter, cream) I won't need to buy more anytime soon because it's a 12 jar set but I would definitely recommend them others.
customer_reviews.author: Purple Sparklers

customer_reviews.title: Great containers
customer_reviews.text: I like how these are made in the u.s Great baby food containers for freezing
customer_reviews.author: MamaT5

customer_reviews.title: best bet uet
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this when we started looking for something to use for my lil mans food was rough and overwhelming. Alot of the ice cube tray type ones didn't seem goox for long term use we tried one amd within twondaysbfood was freezer burnt. So we went to try these instead. Definitely glad we did absolutely the best purchase we use it all the time keeps food fresh great for measure of how much food he eats and the labels come off easy for cleaning and dont smudge at all
customer_reviews.author: smilez5696

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, perfect portion sizes for toddler
customer_reviews.text: I have bought two sets of these to freeze Portions of curry, veggies, meat sauce etc for my toddler. Usually one portion of whatever main meal with veg is perfect for him.. Love these containers. I have used them over and over
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Love these!!
customer_reviews.text: We love these for our homemade baby food! They store easy in the fridge or freezer and stack great when not in use. I love that the plastic is BPA free, the tops are screw on, and than it holds up to 4oz. My husband loves that they come with labels that are ready to read, and our daughter enjoys the benefits of fresh food!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Thumps up
customer_reviews.text: Love these. So useful and easy to clean and use. Love the labels but sucks they don’t sell them separately.
customer_reviews.author: Maleah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect baby food jar!
customer_reviews.text: Affordable and perfect for what I needed it for. Baby is past the baby food stage but I still use these to put my condiments in and I still use to put baby’s snacks in.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for your baby food storage
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for baby food storage for daycare. These have been great for us. You can put it in dishwasher so it’s easy to clean after a long day. I wish size was a little bigger. But other than that love the product and would recommend buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Verified purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Not shatter proof
customer_reviews.text: I like these jars for the most part, but when removing from the freezer they shatter like glass when dropped. If you are looking for a more resilient jar, this might not be it.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Not what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: I love these, but, it's not what I ordered. I ordered a 12 pack of the plastic ones and got a 6 pack of glass ones. I need 12, otherwise these are perfect. Anyway, I have to order more.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Elias

customer_reviews.title: Not good for freezer
customer_reviews.text: Overall good, but I wouldn’t say it is freezer safe. It got broken when frozen
customer_reviews.author: Alona Z.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great value
customer_reviews.text: These cups are great. I had been saving glass food jars to use for microwaving the frozen cubes of food I make my son, and the dish I was sending to daycare for him never stayed closed and leaked everywhere. These cups are great, the perfect size and can be microwaved and stay securely shut for transport. You get so many for such a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie G

customer_reviews.title: Handle with care
customer_reviews.text: Good for storage, but not dishwasher safe. As after multiple washes, the lid gets loose. Not recommending it for longevity
customer_reviews.author: ASparent

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for one serving-Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Love them. My husband loves to make batches of spaghetti sauce and I have been searching for freezer safe containers small enough to hold one serving of the sauce. These are perfect.They are freezer, microwave, and dishwasher safe. I am planning on ordering a second set so I can meal prep other foods.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam Hoebel

customer_reviews.title: they are a good portable size and fit nicely in my diaper bag
customer_reviews.text: I bought these little containers to carry baby snacks, they are a good portable size and fit nicely in my diaper bag. The lid screws on pretty tight and I haven't had any spill in my bag so it's secure. I hand wash these but I believe they may be dishwasher safe.
customer_reviews.author: Jackelin Orellana

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 sets for our Daughter for homemade baby food. She loves them.
customer_reviews.author: MomsCoffee

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to open and close and the perfect size
customer_reviews.text: These work really well, but I don't use them as intended. I use them to store a couple weeks worth of horse supplements for all my horses, it is a lot easier than having to open large buckets of supplements every day (also convenient if someone else feeds my horse). Very easy to open and close and the perfect size.
customer_reviews.author: Pinky's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good containers
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Item looks just like picture. Four stars because they don’t actually come with labels like the description says but are still good quality containers.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Recommend but they do leak a little.
customer_reviews.text: Really like these, the size is perfect. Docked a star though because they do leak, which is unfortunate. The stickers that come with it are great.
customer_reviews.author: Valenz Family

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! Easy to use for my toddler and baby. I put snacks for the toddler and baby purée for my little one. Versatile and super easy to clean and use.
customer_reviews.author: USCkitty

customer_reviews.title: Multi use!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for a baby shower to glue cars onto and fill with candy.. I use the glass ones for food, and these plastic are good for on the go purposes or crafts!
customer_reviews.author: A.NzTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Good product! Great size for starting solids with baby ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product! Great size for starting solids with baby and comes with labels for easy storing. One thing I didn't realize was that they cannot go in the microwave, which makes it more difficult if you are freezing baby food, however, I would have realized this if I had done more research. Overall, happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great containers for great price!
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect to store my babies puréed food! Super easy to clean up!! I can fill them and put into my bag for dinners going out! I also take an empty to add our food for baby to sample! Love love this!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: I don't like they break so easily. My baby likes to play with them, now the bottom of the jar breaks as well as the lid. They still work even the bottom and the lid chips. They are otherwise good containers just not very sturdy especially if your baby likes to play with them
customer_reviews.author: fuguzn

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Holds baby food perfect frozen or not it stores food perfectly for our baby.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Fine, but not necessary
customer_reviews.text: These are fine. They are the same size as pint sized jelly jars though so you might as well buy the jelly jars that come in a dozen to a pack with metal lids instead of plastic. If you want something cute that comes with its own labels, these will do the job. I dropped one on our stone floor and the top shattered though, so now I'm using regular metal jar lids for them anyway.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bryant

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: these are wonderful little containers for freezeing a small portion of food for my daughter. had a couple lids break from dropping them out of the freezer but otherwise great
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Cracking Problems
customer_reviews.text: After a couple months of using these they have started to crack and come apart. Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Exactly what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Exactly what I expected. It has instructions on how to use it to store baby food and even comes with stickers for the dates that you made the food. To conserve stickers, I make batches and put the sticker on the last one I use. On a less important side note, the company logo on the side is super cute :)
customer_reviews.author: J L Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great to store home made food
customer_reviews.text: Perfect to store home made food for the little one . Just what I was looking for . Easy to clean. Jar can fit in the bottle warmer . No leak.
customer_reviews.author: maria ly

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: They kind of look like urine sample cups but they work great. Love them and if I need more containers, I will buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Justeen

customer_reviews.title: These things are great!. They are easy to wash
customer_reviews.text: I started to make home made baby food and needed storage containers. These things are great!. They are easy to wash, I freeze them then defrost them in a pot with boiling water. I will definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: sara Massari

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied. As described. The size is just perfect . Very useful and easy to use . 100% Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Jose Verde

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I've been using them for a while now and they hold up great. I also like that you they have volume markings so you know how much you're feeding your baby.
customer_reviews.author: Nermeen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Loving these! Very cute. Love that they are dishwasher safe, freezable & not a bunch of crazy colors. Simple.
customer_reviews.author: Ericka Ho

product_meta.title: Baby Food Storage Containers - Sage Spoonfuls Mini 4oz Storage Jars (3pk) - BPA Free
feature_bullets: SET OF 3 BPA FREE PLASTIC 4 OZ JARS WITH MEASUREMENTS MARKS – Easily portion, serve, store & warm baby food with our 4oz baby food storage jars. Measurements marked to 3oz - jar has 4oz fill capacity

MICROWAVE, DISHWASHER & FREEZER SAFE – Portion, serve, store & warm baby food all in the same jar. Fridge & Freezer safe. To defrost or warm food, remove lid from jar & place into the microwave or warm water. Jars & lids are top-rack dishwasher safe

MADE IN THE USA OF HIGH QUALITY, FOOD SAFE BPA FREE PLASTIC - High quality and built to last with easy-to-use BPA free screw on lids that provide an airtight and leak proof seal to keep food fresh and liquids contained

BPA, LEAD, PHTHALATE AND PVC FREE - These baby food jars and lids do not contain BPA, Phthalates, Lead or PVC. ideal for homemade baby food, storing breastmilk and formula, finger foods for babies and toddlers, yogurt, snacks and more

MAKE IT A SET– Sage Spoonfuls is an award-winning line of baby, toddler & big kid feeding products. From prepping, serving & storing baby food to toddler & big kid mealtime essentials, Sage Spoonfuls has you covered. Buy the entire line on Amazon.com
Making baby food has never been so easy! Portion, store, freeze, warm and serve delicious, healthy homemade baby food
Convenient freezer safe, dishwasher safe(top rack) and microwave safe
Measurement marking, clear containers and 30 easy to remove, biodegradable paper labels; So no guessing on contents
High quality and comfortable to hold, these durable, portable jars have leak proof and easy to use screw on lids
